New Records: Virat Kohli hit his 50th ODI century - a world record going past the great Sachin Tendulkar
Shreyas Iyer joined a select group of India players with back-to-back World Cup hundreds
Key Match Events: Virat Kohli scored an unbeaten 122 off 94 balls
Kuldeep Yadav bowled the 41st and the 43rd for just six runs and a wicket
Rohit Sharma played like he is invincible and has not taken a backwards step
Pre-Game Insights: India recorded the highest score of 397/4
Mohammed Shami picked up a seven-for
Shreyas Iyer proved to be a middle-order powerhouse
Kuldeep Yadav bowling in the death
Rohit Sharma playing like he is invincible
India's winning probability rose almost 10% after Shami's intervention
Post-Match Reflections: Hardik Pandya expressed pride in the team's resilience after a close win
Rohit Sharma remarked that winning the series was a significant morale booster ahead of the World Cup
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rain interrupted play, reducing the game to 20 overs per side
India ended their ICC trophy drought, winning their first title since 2013
India maintained their unbeaten World Cup record against Pakistan
